definitions.definition: ( poker ) To make a bluff; to give the impression that one’s hand is stronger than it is.
examples: John bluffed by betting without even a pair.

definitions.definition: ( by analogy ) To frighten, deter, or deceive with a false show of strength or confidence; to give a false impression of strength or temerity in order to intimidate or gain some advantage .
examples: The government claims it will call an election if this bill does not pass. Is it truly ready to do so, or is it bluffing ?

definitions.definition: To perform or achieve by bluffing.
examples: We bluffed our way past the guards.

definitions.definition: ( Manglish , Singlish ) To give false information intentionally , to lie (to someone), to deceive ; to put on an act .

main_definition: ( poker ) To make a bluff; to give the impression that one’s hand is stronger than it is.
secondary_definitions: ( by analogy ) To frighten, deter, or deceive with a false show of strength or confidence; to give a false impression of strength or temerity in order to intimidate or gain some advantage .
To perform or achieve by bluffing.
( Manglish , Singlish ) To give false information intentionally , to lie (to someone), to deceive ; to put on an act .

definitions.definition: To fluff , puff or swell up.

main_definition: To fluff , puff or swell up.
